thread.title: CNN’s Jim Acosta: WH List on Underreported Terror Attacks Is a ‘Head-Scratcher’
thread.title_full: CNN’s Jim Acosta: WH List on Underreported Terror Attacks Is a ‘Head-Scratcher’

author: Josh Feldman
title: CNN’s Jim Acosta: WH List on Underreported Terror Attacks Is a ‘Head-Scratcher’
text:
CNN’s Jim Acosta: WH List on Underreported Terror Attacks Is a ‘Head-Scratcher’  56   
CNN’s Jim Acosta tonight said he had been given a list by the White House to back up President Trump ‘s claims on underreported terrorist attacks. 
As the president spoke at CENTCOM today, he talked about terrorist attacks in France and elsewhere in Europe before saying “It’s gotten to a point where it’s not even being reported, and in many cases the very, very dishonest press doesn’t want to report it.” 
Sean Spicer later said the president just feels certain terrorist attacks go underreported by the media and the White House would release a list to back up what the president said. 
Acosta tonight held up the list and told Erin Burnett , “There are 78 attacks listed on this list, and I have to tell you, Erin, it’s a head-scratcher.” 
Why? Because, Acosta said, the list includes Paris, San Bernardino, Brussels, Istanbul, and Nice––all of which Acosta said the press “covered extensively.” 
“It’s puzzling,” he observed, “as to why the White House would include these attacks on this list when they were covered for days on end.” 
CNN’s Dan Merica posted the full list he received on Twitter: A White House official says "most" of these 78 attacks since 2014 have not received enough attention from media. pic.twitter.com/v66rcHxAFI 
— Dan Merica (@danmericaCNN) February 7, 2017 
Watch above, via CNN.
